website_summaries.verdict: The tent to choose if you want some more space for your large group while avoiding the usual cramped feel.
pros: The Y-shaped profile of the tent maximizes space for 11-person groups or larger
Includes three separate doors so people can enter and exit the tent without tripping over others
cons: Support stakes can come undone in bad weather depending on the ground soil

customer_reviews.title: huge!
customer_reviews.text: A couple things i didnt find real clear. 1-there is 2 "bedrooms" and a "porch" area that can be used as a bedroom. (i wasnt clear if there was a total of 3 or 4......theres a total of 3. The tent is shaped kinda like a fidget spinner. also room dividers are just hang down flaps that do not zip. The tent itself is great though and went up easy and quick. :)
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D.

customer_reviews.title: Great tent easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Great tent easy to set up. I recommend a practice run in your yard before going on any family trips. One person can absolutely set this up but two is even easier.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Jendrasko III

customer_reviews.title: I actually love this tent!
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 people in my family so this tent was perfect. My recommendation is to by camp dry spray with it... like maybe 6 cans... because honestly most tents that you buy nowadays are not completely rain proof. But this goes up easy and as long as you make sure all walls and lines are as taut as possible you will be fine. Our first excursion was extremely windy and rainy and we were fine even with our campsite being slightly flooded we were dry. Kids love camping in their tent "castle".
customer_reviews.author: emmerly

customer_reviews.title: Spacious and quick set up/tear down
customer_reviews.text: Set up takes about 2-5 min depending on if you stake it down or not. Tear down takes about 5 min mostly due to folding it properly and getting it back in the bag. We used it 4 days in a row in 4 different locations and thankfully the set up is quick since out of no where we were hit with a summer storm- hail included! It handled the storm and didn’t leak. It’s comfortably spacious, we had 4 large cots plus a large dog cage and cat kennels and we still had plenty of room. I would definitely purchase this again and I highly recommend this rent!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Balcom

customer_reviews.title: Family tent but no privacy
customer_reviews.text: Used this for our family camping trip. It was very difficult to assemble bit finally got it up. The inside dividers are a total joke. There is no privacy in the tent. The dividers only hook at the top and bottom sort of but do not offer any privacy either with thickness of the divider or at edges.
customer_reviews.author: Annette :L Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Tent is huge
customer_reviews.text: This tent is huge!! We love camping and our tent started leaking so we decided to get a new one. With the kids getting older this tent is perfect for the family to still camp together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice but might be broken
customer_reviews.text: Mine cane broken and instead of sending a new one I just got half refunded. I mean it’s nice me my boyfriend and our friends used it we just had to be extra careful because one side collapses on us if we move around too much. We did fit 2 queen size air mattresses in the rooms with enough room for extra stuff in there
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Wrong tent
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this tent that summer. But I did not open it until this year. It was the wrong tent.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Ms. First time Camper
customer_reviews.text: Was able to set up in 6 minutes in the dark on wet ground with 2 men and no instructions. We had one queen and twin mattress and room for our things but another mattress would’ve been uncomfortable. Has dividers but we didn’t use them just a big open space. Same tent mines was green.
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopping Mommy

customer_reviews.title: $300 GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: This tent is hot garbage. Thre people that reviewed it highly are either lying or know absolutely nothing about tents. This thing has flimsy written all over it, not to mention the middle poles don't even touch the ground. I mean not even close. They're about 8" off! The floor seems thin, zippers cheap, fabric and mesh super thin. The hubs where you fold the tent up collapse if the tent is tugged in one direction or the other, no matter how well you have it staked down. For almost $300 this should at least work for one camping trip. I don't say this often about anything, but, DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put up.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice tent with an awkward layout. Would be nice in a T shape instead of the Y shape. We have had for 2 years now and are already looking for a new tent. Family of 4 and the tent seems crowded once cots and gear are loaded inside. We camp several times throughout the year and this tent is pretty durable.
customer_reviews.author: Bo J.

customer_reviews.title: DESCRIPTION IS NOT ACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Ozark Trail tent. loved the previous version which was the T style. this is a Y style. The description says 3 room cabin tent with screen room. its actually 2 room and a screen room. the screen room is the 3rd room. We di spray the seams with waterproof spray. We had torrential rains and a little bit of leaks by the floor. again it was alot of rain. I think it held up great. I am keeping the tent.
customer_reviews.author: DA
